channel.title: blogging on The long way through Software Craftsmanship
channel.description: Recent content in blogging on The long way through Software Craftsmanship

item.title: Inserting clojure code in octopress
item.description: Inserting this code in the blog: ```clojure (defn all-access[k] (let [{:keys [a b] :as k}] (do a) (do (:b k)))) ``` the octopress processor throws the error: Error: Pygments can't parse unknown language: clojure Error: Run jekyll build --trace for more information. A solution would be to include it as lisp code: ```lisp (defn all-access[k] (let [{:keys [a b] :as k}] (do a) (do (:b k)))) ``` this is an example:
